message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.DS 

The paper deals with the problem of improving the tractability of large-scale partially observable Markov decision processes (POMDPs) using linear belief compression. This involves finding projections from high-dimensional belief space onto low-dimensional approximations, which is a common problem in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves optimization techniques (cs.RO) and control systems (cs.SY) to solve the POMDPs. Additionally, the paper involves the analysis of existing methods and the proposal of a new algorithm, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
